description: Manage routes in a route table.

commands.name: az network route-table route create
commands.summary: Create a route in a route table.
commands.syntax:
az network route-table route create --name
                                    --resource-group
                                    --route-table-name
                                    [--address-prefix]
                                    [--next-hop-ip-address]
                                    [--next-hop-type {Internet, None, VirtualAppliance, VirtualNetworkGateway, VnetLocal}]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
examples: az network route-table route create -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable -n MyRoute --next-hop-type VirtualAppliance --address-prefix 10.0.0.0/16 --next-hop-ip-address 10.0.100.4

commands.name: az network route-table route delete
commands.summary: Delete a route from a route table.
commands.syntax:
az network route-table route delete [--ids]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--route-table-name]
                                    [--subscription]
examples: az network route-table route delete -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable -n MyRoute

commands.name: az network route-table route list
commands.summary: List routes in a route table.
examples: az network route-table route list -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable

commands.name: az network route-table route show
commands.summary: Get the details of a route in a route table.
examples: az network route-table route show -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable -n MyRoute -o table

commands.name: az network route-table route update
commands.summary: Update a route in a route table.
commands.syntax:
az network route-table route update [--add]
                                    [--address-prefix]
                                    [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--ids]
                                    [--name]
                                    [--next-hop-ip-address]
                                    [--next-hop-type {Internet, None, VirtualAppliance, VirtualNetworkGateway, VnetLocal}]
                                    [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                    [--remove]
                                    [--resource-group]
                                    [--route-table-name]
                                    [--set]
                                    [--subscription]
examples: az network route-table route update -g MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable -n MyRoute --next-hop-ip-address 10.0.100.5

az network route-table route update --address-prefix 10.0.0.0/16 --name MyRoute --next-hop-ip-address 10.0.100.5 --next-hop-type VirtualNetworkGateway --resource-group MyResourceGroup --route-table-name MyRouteTable

commands.name: az network route-table route wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
